pullRequest.body:
Previously the order in which the assumptions were added was determined by `Expr` hashes, which while deterministic are not part of the user's mental model.

This matters (see [Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/nlinarith.20is.20affected.20by.20.60example.60s/near/449994710)) because it then affects the order in which metavariables are unified.

As a bonus(?), this now means that squares are now found up to reducible defeq.

---

  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9883118719/job/27297260338)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9883118719/job/27297260525)

```suggestion
A pair `(i, true)` is added to `s` when `atoms[i]^2` appears in `e`,
```
To make this more deterministic, could we sort `si.toList`? Otherwise it comes out in whatever order the hash turns out to be. Let's sort by the lex order of the pairs.
How about using an `RBSet` instead, so that we can do the sorting as we go?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - fix(nlinarith): make `findSquares` deterministic
